name: Traumatic Aortic Dissection with Hemothorax
chief_complaint: Tearing chest pain and difficulty breathing after a high-speed car crash
symptoms: Sudden severe chest pain radiating to the back
physical_findings: Asymmetric blood pressure between arms (>20 mmHg difference)
Decreased breath sounds on left hemithorax
treatment: Immediate blood pressure control with IV beta-blockers
Definitive surgical repair with TEVAR (if stable)
prognosis: Guarded - 40-60% mortality even with prompt treatment. Risk of paraplegia, renal failure, or stroke in survivors.
description: A life-threatening condition where blunt trauma causes separation of aortic wall layers, often at the ligamentum arteriosum, with concurrent pleural space bleeding. Requires immediate differentiation from myocardial infarction and rapid surgical intervention.
